messages.content: ComfyUI Coziness is a collection of custom nodes for ComfyUI, which is a GUI for using a stable diffusion model to generate images and videos.
What does the MultiLora Loader node do?
The MultiLora Loader node uses a textual description to specify which Loras to add to a checkpoint model. You can add the node from the 'loaders' category at 'loaders > MultiLora Loader'.
How do I add the MultiLora Loader node to ComfyUI?
To install the MultiLora Loader node, you can either add the MultiLoraLoader.py file to the ComfyUI 'custom_nodes' directory, or clone the ComfyUI-Coziness repo into the 'custom_nodes' directory.
How do I connect the inputs and outputs of the MultiLora Loader node?
In the MultiLora Loader node, you can type the Loras you want to use, each on one line, in the format 'file_name[:weight1[:weight2]]'. You can also use Automatic1111's lora syntax.
What does the Lora Text Extractor node do?

The Lora Text Extractor node takes the input text and extracts Loras specified using Automatic1111's lora syntax out of it. It has two outputs: one for the filtered text without the Loras and another with the Loras removed, separated by newlines.
How do I connect the outputs of the Lora Text Extractor node?

To connect the outputs of the Lora Text Extractor node, you have to convert the text boxes of the CLIP Text Encode and MultiLora Loader nodes into inputs by right-clicking them and selecting 'Convert text to input' from the menu.
When was the last update to ComfyUI-Coziness made?
The latest update to ComfyUI-Coziness was made on 2024/2/22.
What is the latest feature added to ComfyUI-Coziness?
The latest update added support for connecting Lora Text Extractor directly to the lora stack inputs of 'Efficiency Nodes for ComfyUI'.
